intro: Johrenia pichleri, commonly known as the Pichler's johrenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, particularly in Guatemala and Honduras. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
